title: For Sale:  H&K P30 40 S&W NIB
postcontent: A recent HK pistol design, the P30 is a modern police and security pistol that combines function and safety. Ergonomic features include a special grip frame with interchangeable backstrap inserts and lateral plates, allowing the pistol to be individually adapted to any user. Ambidextrous controls include dual slide releases and magazine release levers. The conventional double-action/single action models have a serrated decocking button located on the rear of the frame. The HK Law Enforcement Modification (LEM) trigger system combines the advantages of a cocked striker component (constant level of trigger pull from first to last round fired) with a double-action hammer system. Using such an enhanced trigger system consolidates ease of use and safety into a convenient, innovative trigger operation—one that reduces the chance of unintended firing. And in case of an ammunition-related failure to fire, all that is needed is an additional second or third squeeze of the trigger without the need of first pulling the slide back to re-cock the pistol. The enhanced LEM trigger system combines the reliability of a double action revolver trigger with the crisp trigger of a single action pistol. A Picatinny rail molded into the front of the frame makes mounting lights, laser aimers, or other accessories easy and convenient. The extractor doubles as a loaded chamber indicator providing a subtle tactile and visual reminder of a loaded chamber. Extensively tested, the P30 has already been adopted by several European police agencies. Excellent weight and balance make the P30 naturally pointable, easy to control, and accurate to shoot. An open notch rear sight with luminous (non-radioactive) contrast points allows for fast and accurate target acquisition, even under poor lighting conditions. Call Rick at 941-224-6895.

It has a Head plate that drops down over the shoulder to present a hostage style target. The second is a Center Mass plate and the third is a Pelvic plate.
The second target is a Single Paddle Target that has one Paddle over the Center Mass area. When hit, it moves to over the shoulder to present a hostage style target.

title: For Sale:  Colt Pony Automatic #53
postcontent:
PRICE REDUCTION! Had a deal set but the buyer bailed.

This is #53/100 of the original Colt Pony Automatic. Only 100 of these were made. These pistols were manufactured by Colt in a factory based in Washington D.C. (Washington D.C. Firearms International). This pistol is a .380 and it shoots great. These pistols are extremely rare and highly sought after by Colt collectors that know a little Colt History. There isn't a lot of information known about these pistols and their manufacture because the D.C. factory they were produced in, was destroyed in the 1968 D.C. riots.

I have contacted Colt and I have received some interesting news about these pistols. These pistols were made for Colt because Colt was considering have their .380 handguns manufactured by another company, this did not end up happening. However, 100 of these pistols were made for Colt in the 60's and 11 of them were retained by Colt Firearms, the other 89 were given back to the D.C. company.

You know you have one of these rare pistols when the serial number on it begins with CPA (Colt Pony Automatic). 

Call or text, call is quicker, text is more convenient. 1-REDACTED

title: For Sale:  380 Auto Standard Pressure Ammo 90 gr. JHP (1025 fps/M.E. 210 ft. lbs.) - 20 Round Box Box
postcontent:
http://extreme-impact-ammo.com/index.php?l=product_detail&p=218

The 380 auto inhabits a valuable and useful place in our society, mostly because of the easily concealable, tiny pistols chambered for it. HOWEVER, because of the very limited size of the cartridge, it is plagued with limited power and therefore most of the existing ammo in 380 auto suffers from not being reliable as a man-stopper. We've studied and played with nearly all of the existing available 380 ammo and find it wanting as a reliable means of self defense, especially against a large, insane, drugged up/pain free, determined attacker.

Here's the problem. The current 380 auto frangible ammo delivers a large amount of surface trauma, but lacks serious penetration. For example, if you shot me or another sane man in the face with modern frangible 380 ammo, it would blow off a big portion of my cheek and send a few teeth down my throat, I would undoubtedly fall to the ground in shock and pain, but I would be very much alive and functional if I could get past the shock and pain as that frangible bullet would have stopped some where inside my face, never making it to my brain. However, if you shot a drugged up maniac in the face with that same frangible 380 ammo and blew half his cheek off, he would keep right on coming because he is insane and is not thinking like you or I. Plus, he is likely pain free and fear free and wont know that half his cheek is missing and if he did know, he would not care. So whatever 380 ammo you shoot him in the face with, had better go through his face and blow his brain stem out the back of his head, because only a CNS (central nervous system) hit with a 380 is going to stop him. Likewise, a torso hit to the sternum needs to penetrate deep enough to blow all the way through his spine in order to shut him down spontaneously. If you fail to shut him down instantly, you and your loved ones are going to have to find a way to survive while you wait for him to bleed out and pass out. The best chance of survival for you and your family is to shut down the attacker instantly. So, we've designed a few 380 auto standard pressure loads to keep you and your loved ones alive under the worst of scenarios.

Item 27G/20 is a 90gr. Jacketed Hollow Point bullet. It is traveling over 1,050 fps out of my BDA (Browning Double Action) with its 3.75 inch barrel.  We've utilized the very same flash suppressed powders that we've used in our two other 380 auto standard pressure loads. If you like the idea of the extra big hole this expanding load makes in human flesh, we would advise that you load this bullet in your chamber, followed by a magazine full of our non-expanding loads. So, if the first shot does not incapacitate the attacker, your magazine is full of ammo that will, if you can put the bullet in his spine or brain from any angle. Note my "real world" velocities from my personal "real world" pistols.

1. BDA-3.75 inch barrel----1061 fps
2. Walther PPK-3.5 inch barrel-----1049 fps
3. Colt Mustang Pocket Lite-2.75 inch barrel---970 fps
4. Keltec---949 fps

title: For Sale/Trade:  SUV Gun / Storage Lock Box
postcontent:
Selling a Custom built SUV Gun & Storage Lock Box. It has 3 heavy duty slide out drawers (100lb heavy duty rated rollers) that have places for padlocks on them so you can store your Guns, ammo or valuables without worry. It was custom built for a '03 Nissan Xterra so it should fit in just about any SUV. It no longer has the rubber mat pictured on top but it would be easy to add one if desired. The top 2 drawers are the same size (28"Length X 17"Wide X 7"Deep) and both have a foam rubber thin pad to keep items from being scratched and to keep them from moving while driving. The bottom drawer (28"Length X 37-1/2"Wide X 6"Deep) has 2 full pieces of 1" thick foam (the same used in a gun case) that are uncut so you can custom cut it to fit you guns and/or accessories in the foam. Or just leave them on top. 

The entire Box size is 30"Length X 41-1/2"Wide X 17-1/2"Deep. Has stainless handles and padlocks. If you purchased one this size new from a manufacture you would pay anywhere between $800 - $2,000 so this is a good deal if you're looking for one. I have around $250 in material invested in it plus the aggravation, I mean "pleasure", of designing and building it. It's heavy duty and built to last using high grade pressure treated / water sealed lumber. I sold the xterra and have had it covered in storage since. 

This thing is great for Law Enforcement personal vehicles, preppers or for hunting. Well built, sturdy lockbox. Would work as well in the bed of a truck if bolted or strapped down. 

Asking $500 cash or trade for firearms/ammo. Open to reasonable offers.

Text REDACTED

title: For Sale:  ZAR  DWM 1893 Chilean Mauser
postcontent:
DWM manufactured 7MM Mauser 1893. - $225
It was made for Zuid-Afrikaansche Republiek (South African Republic) or ZAR. Due to a British navel blockade these rifles never made it to South Africa so they were sent back to Germany where the crest was rollmarked to Chile and off they went. 
Proper square bolt. Serial numbers match for the receiver, stock, and floor plate.
It's been sporterized but the blueing looks original.
Clean bore with no pitting.

Rifle was a war trophy and has spent several years in storage.
I can provide more and larger photos upon request.

Receiver: Lightweight aluminum alloy   Barrel:  Lightweight 28" Silver Finish

Silver. A shining example of performance, quality and real value. The name Browning is synonymous with no-nonsense, high-performance autoloaders having superb finish and unmatched handling. And with an easily recognizable semi-humpbacked receiver silhouette, Browning’s Silver shotguns perfectly honor that historic legacy. Sharing the same proven Active Valve gas operation as the Gold, the Silver is one of the softest recoiling and easiest shooting guns available today, delivering up to a 50% decrease in felt recoil over the competition. The Active Valve also makes the Silver one of the most versatile and reliable shotguns around, able to fire a wide range of factory loads under the most extreme conditions. Back-Bored Barrel Technology ensures your shot patterns are tight, dense, even and consistent, and provides an additional reduction in felt recoil. See your Browning dealer and pull the trigger on a new Silver today.  
Less recoil with the Active Valve
The self-adjusting Active Valve gas system in the Silver autoloaders uses gas from fired shells to operate the action instead of contributing to recoil. When shooting light loads, most of the gases operate the action. With magnum loads, only a small amount of gas is necessary to operate the action, while the remaining gases are vented through the Active Valve and out the top of the forearm and away from the receiver for clean, reliable operation. Because the gas piston and Active Valve operate independently, less pressure is exerted on the gas piston for greater longevity and more efficient operation than other gas-operated autoloaders. Because the Active Valve expels unnecessary gases, it naturally reduces felt recoil before it ever reaches your shoulder — without the need for heavy hydraulic recoil dampers, sticky gel pads and gimmicky gel stock inserts. Superior recoil reduction from the Active Valve also equals faster, more accurate follow-up shots and all-day shooting comfort regardless of the loads used.
Load Versatility
The Active Valve-equipped gas piston automatically adjusts to reliably fire a wide range of loads. 12 gauge 3" models fire everything from light, 1 oz., 2 3/4" target loads to the heaviest 3" magnums. The larger 3 1/2" version is built to handle a similar range, from 1 1/8 oz., 2 3/4" field loads up to hard-hitting 3 1/2" magnums.
Trigger
Gold-colored. The trigger guard is large and has carefully rounded edges to accommodate gloved fingers. Additionally, the Silver’s trigger assembly can be removed in seconds for cleaning.
Back-Bored Barrels
Silver shotguns feature Back-Bored Technology.
Magazine Capacity
2 3/4": Four in magazine, one in chamber. 3": Three in magazine, one in chamber. 3 1/2": Three in magazine, one in chamber. A three-shot magazine adapter plug is included.
Choke Tubes
Silver shotguns include the interchangeable Invector-Plus™ choke tube syst
Eligible for the Growth Insurance Program.
Like the new Citori Micro Midas, the new Silver Hunter Micro Midas gas-operated autoloader is trim, lightweight, easy to shoulder and swing and ideal for the smaller shooter. Here is the opportunity to purchase a deluxe autoloader with all the features you need to have a reliable, successful day in the field.

The Troy Industries Folding Rear BattleSight is a highly durable and accurate folding BattleSight used by Special Ops
 and tactical shooters across the planet. 
It features an easy to deploy, spring free system that stays locked in place
thanks to a heavy duty stainless steel cross-locking system. 
To lower the sight, simply push a button to release the lock. 
When folded, these sights are very low profile, sitting at just 0.460 inches, 
allowing a wider array of optics to be mounted over it. 
When deployed they position both apertures at the same height as the factory irons. 
The mounting system is easy to use and does not cant on all military and aftermarket receivers. Adjusting the sight
does not require any special tools! This sight must be mounted to a same-plane rail system.
The Troy Industries Rear Folding BattleSight is manufactured from 6061 T6 hardened aircraft grade aluminum with stainless steel 
components and MIL-SPEC hard coat anodized in matte black.

Features:
Zero-Canting attachment system works with all military and aftermarket receivers
Low-profile design folds to just 0.460 inches!
Sight locks securely in the up position thanks to a heavy duty stainless steel cross-lock.
No tool adjustments, each click is .50MOA
Deploys apertures to the same height as factory A2 style sights.
Wide angle Dual-Aperture design allows for extra-low profile mounting!
Manufactured from 6061 T6 hardened aircraft grade aluminum with stainless steel components
MIL-SPEC Type III hard coat anodized in matte Black

NEW Midwest Industries Elite Flip-Up Locking Front Sight, below cost. Top quality low profile sight, aluminum construction and
 ultra sleek when folded. For use with railed hand guards or gas blocks the same height as upper receiver. 
When folded, super low profile is only .437“ off top of rail. Made in the U.S.A. 

Brand new in the package. Cost $89.95 at Primary Arms, $91 on Amazon, and $99.95 directly from Midwest (see links below).

http://www.primaryarms.com/Midwest-Industries-LowProfile-FlipUp-Lockin-p/mi-lffr.htm

http://www.amazon.com/Midwest-Industries-Locking-Profile-Front/dp/B005HJ67S8

http://www.midwestindustriesinc.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=category.display&category_ID=283


Super smooth ball bearing pivot detent
Uses standard A2 front sight post
Automatically locks in the raised position with locking detent
Hard coat anodized 6061 aluminum construction
Made in the USA

The Midwest Industry Folding Battle Sights are Elite Back Up Iron Sights (BUIS) in terms of quality and design. The globe shape allows fast target acquisition and is the first choice for Special Forces. These M4 Carbine or AR15 sights are easily installed and deployed. The aperture position is the exact same height as the factory sights. The heavy duty locking detent ensures your sights will remain up and zeroed in the most extreme combat conditions. To fold simply press the release button located on the left side of the sight. Lightweight construction from high quality 6061 aluminum, the sight is hard coat anodized for a lifetime of service. title: For Sale:  Vet Bring Back Japanese Arisaka Type 99 7.7mm Rifle W/Bayonet Wall Hanger
location: 3920 N. Academy Blvd., Colorado Springs, Colorado
postcontent:
We have a WWII GI Bring Back Arisaka Type 99 bolt action rifle for sale. This was made in Japan. It is chambered in 7.7mm. This comes as shown with bayonet. This is in poor non firing condition. There is plenty of rust prevalent. The stock is cracked on both sides at the wrist. The bolt is very hard to operate. We are selling this a wall hanger for your collection only. We do not recommend firing this weapon. It was brought back by our consignors grandfather after World War II. His grandfather carved his initials on the stock and again on the bayonet. There are no bring back papers for this rifle. There are no import marks on it. The Mum has been struck out and ground off. There are no visible remaining marks that show the Chrysanthemum. Our consignor was given this by his family after his grandfather passed. He has no further information as to where his grandpa was stationed or when it was brought back. All we have is the soldiers name. 

Priced at $150.00 with sales tax included. Shipping is available. Local trades welcome. Must be 18yrs or older and pass a background check. 

Stop Drop & Shop, Your Pawnshop Alternative. Where you can buy, sell and trade almost anything. 3920 N. Academy. Colorado Springs, CO 80917. 10am-6pm Mon-Fri & 10am-5pm Sat. REDACTED

Check out our other Armslist Postings:

http://www.armslist.com/classifieds/colorado/guns?search=3920+academy


We buy clean, functional firearms. Trades are always welcome. Walk out with something new or just a hand full of cash.

postcontent:
Very nice Regal Finished Para 1911 Model # PCX745R (not the same as the PCX745E which was the all blued, steel framed model) with contrasting nickel slide stop, mag release, hammer, grip safety/beavertail and hammer. This IS NOT a GI model. This gun was made before Para introduced their GI LTC model (which is not the same gun at all).

This gun includes upgrades such as Alloy Frame, Dovetailed Sights, Full-Length Stainless Guide Rod, Para's patented "Power Extractor", a 4.25" Ramped Match Barrel and a lowered and flared ejection port. I have owned this gun since it was new and have shot an average of 250 rounds a year through it since 2009. I clean my guns regularly and maintain them meticulously. Gun retains ~92-95% of original finish and only has a few places that show wear due to carry.

Price is which includes all original accessories, paperwork, 2 8-round magazines and Carry Case. Must be willing to sign Firearms Bill of Sale and submit Pistol Purchase Permit or NC CHP.

Less recoil with the Active Valve
The self-adjusting Active Valve gas system in the Silver autoloaders uses gas from fired shells to operate the action instead of contributing to recoil. When shooting light loads, most of the gases operate the action. With magnum loads, only a small amount of gas is necessary to operate the action, while the remaining gases are vented through the Active Valve and out the top of the forearm and away from the receiver for clean, reliable operation. Because the gas piston and Active Valve operate independently, less pressure is exerted on the gas piston for greater longevity and more efficient operation than other gas-operated autoloaders. Because the Active Valve expels unnecessary gases, it naturally reduces felt recoil before it ever reaches your shoulder — without the need for heavy hydraulic recoil dampers, sticky gel pads and gimmicky gel stock inserts. title: For Sale:  Get it now, 2/12 is too late.
postcontent:
Thinking of parting with my RRA PDS carbine. Setup as it now stands includes:
1) RRA Tri rail system, new cost $170
2) forward grip
3) diamond head flip up BUIS 
4) Trijicon 1x24 reflex ACOG 
5) premium stock with additional space for storage

Typically the rifle without these additions retails for about $1600-1700 when you can find them. Since the Rock River piston system doesn't require a buffer tube the entire stock is now available for storage. For example if you have a small Tac light you can put that where the buffer would have been, throw in a couple of extra batteries and keep them with you while keeping your AR as streamlined as possible until you need that light, or laser or whatnot. Maybe the coolest part is that the absence of the buffer lets the stock fold. The RRA folding system doesn't interfere with charging or firing the gun in either position, locks solidly and deploys quickly. It also has a 2 position gas block so that if you're in a field situation, as round count and fouling increase, you can change to HIGH to allow more gas to drive the piston. This keeps you firing when standard gas op ARs may have failed. There are a lot of cool features to this AR, and Rock River is an excellent manufacturer. Since I can't stand folks who say "I don't need to sell, just seeing what's out there" I'll try to be more specific. I'm interested in cash, precious metals, and other quality firearms. Sig 226 family in 9mm, lever action .22s, and other quality ARs get preference, but all will be considered. Not all of the accessories listed have to go with the rifle (except the Tri Rail of course) so let me know what you have to offer and what you want and we can try to make a deal. Mags and Ammo are a possibility if needed. Thanks for reading. Pics on request. All offers get a response.

Silver. A shining example of performance, quality and real value. The name Browning is synonymous with no-nonsense, high-performance autoloaders having superb finish and unmatched handling. And with an easily recognizable semi-humpbacked receiver silhouette, Browning’s Silver shotguns perfectly honor that historic legacy. Sharing the same proven Active Valve gas operation as the Gold, the Silver is one of the softest recoiling and easiest shooting guns available today, delivering up to a 50% decrease in felt recoil over the competition. The Active Valve also makes the Silver one of the most versatile and reliable shotguns around, able to fire a wide range of factory loads under the most extreme conditions. Back-Bored Barrel Technology ensures your shot patterns are tight, dense, even and consistent, and provides an additional reduction in felt recoil. See your Browning dealer and pull the trigger on a new Silver today.  
Less recoil with the Active Valve
The self-adjusting Active Valve gas system in the Silver autoloaders uses gas from fired shells to operate the action instead of contributing to recoil. When shooting light loads, most of the gases operate the action. With magnum loads, only a small amount of gas is necessary to operate the action, while the remaining gases are vented through the Active Valve and out the top of the forearm and away from the receiver for clean, reliable operation. Because the gas piston and Active Valve operate independently, less pressure is exerted on the gas piston for greater longevity and more efficient operation than other gas-operated autoloaders. Because the Active Valve expels unnecessary gases, it naturally reduces felt recoil before it ever reaches your shoulder — without the need for heavy hydraulic recoil dampers, sticky gel pads and gimmicky gel stock inserts. Superior recoil reduction from the Active Valve also equals faster, more accurate follow-up shots and all-day shooting comfort regardless of the loads used.
Load Versatility
The Active Valve-equipped gas piston automatically adjusts to reliably fire a wide range of loads. 12 gauge 3" models fire everything from light, 1 oz., 2 3/4" target loads to the heaviest 3" magnums. The larger 3 1/2" version is built to handle a similar range, from 1 1/8 oz., 2 3/4" field loads up to hard-hitting 3 1/2" magnums.
